title: `CUDA_HOME` is not enough for proper detection
body_html:
I have two versions of cuda (7.5 and 8.0) on my Ubuntu16.04. When I set CUDA_HOME to cuda 8.0 I still got got cuda version 7.5 in install log. After some digging I found CUDA_BIN_PATH in FindCUDA.cmake. After I add this extra environment variable cuda 8.0 was detected successfully.
It looks like, someone don't respect CUDA_HOME.

body:
I have two versions of cuda (7.5 and 8.0) on my Ubuntu16.04. When I set `CUDA_HOME` to cuda 8.0 I still got `got cuda version 7.5` in install log. After some digging I found `CUDA_BIN_PATH` in `FindCUDA.cmake`. After I add this extra environment variable cuda 8.0 was detected successfully.
It looks like, someone don't respect `CUDA_HOME`.
